alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 2:24PM MST until July 26 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... For areas near Dewey-Humboldt and southward in Yavapai County in west central Arizona... * Until 530 PM MST. * At 222 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott Valley, Dewey-humboldt and Lynx Lake Dam. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 277 and 289...and near mile marker 292. Interstate 17 between mile markers 265 and 270. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Brushy Wash, Yarber Wash, Big Bug Creek, Hackberry Wash, Cherry Creek, Chaparral Gulch, Lynx Creek, Osborne Spring Wash, Granite Creek, Little Hackberry Wash, Agua Fria River, Ash Creek, Coyote Wash and Racetrack Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
